icontrol.drivers.instruments.keithley

Class Keithley2600

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.keithley.Keithley2600

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=GPIB,
               InstrumentClassName="Keithley 2600")
public class Keithley2600
extends Device
    This class implements functionality to communicate with a Keithley 2600A System SourceMeter. It was tested with a Keithley 2636 and should work for the entire 2600 class instruments.

    It is recommended to call checkErrorQueue when implementing new methods.

    Instrument Commands:

    • AutoZero(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
    • configDelayTime(String, double, double)
    • configFilters(String, String, int, boolean, boolean)
    • configOffLimit(String, String, float)
    • configSMUChannel(String, String)
    • MeasureI(String)
    • MeasureOPV(String, double, double, double, boolean, String)
    • OutputI(String, float)
    • #OutputState(String, String, double)
    • OutputV(String, double)
    • SweepVmeasureI(String, double, double, double, boolean, String)
    • SweepVmeasureIconfig(java.lang.String, int, int, int, int, boolean)
    • The following commands are implemented as generic GPIB instruments:
    • configAnalogFilters
    • configNPLC
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      Queries the oldest entry of the 2600's Error Queue.
      void Close()
      Overridden Close method that puts the Instrument in a defined state (output is switched to High_Z mode and output voltage and current of both SMUs is set to 0).

      Configures the Settling Delay Time and the Delay factor before taking a measurement.
      void configFilters(java.lang.String SMUChannel, java.lang.String FilterType, int FilterCount, boolean DigitalFilterEnable, boolean AnalogFilterEnable)
      Configures the digital and analog Filters.

      Configures the voltage or current limit when the SMU's output state is set to off.

      Configures the SMU Channel to act as voltage or current source.

      Switches the Auto-Ranging for the SMU Output on or off, and sets the voltage source range if Auto-Ranging is switched off.

      Evaluates the characteristic parameters of an (organic) photovoltaic cell.
      double MeasureI(java.lang.String SMUChannel)
      Measures Current.

      Specialized method to measure (Organic) Photovoltaic Cells (OPV).
      void Open()
      Overwritten Device.Open method that additional to what's done in Device.Open clears the error queue.

      Sets the Current Output Level.
      void OutputState(java.lang.String SMUChannel, java.lang.String OutputState)
      Sets the Output State of the SMU to either on, off, or high_Z.

      Sets the Voltage Output Level.
      double[][] SweepVmeasureI(java.lang.String SMUChannel, double Start, double Stop, double Step, boolean Log, java.lang.String FileExtension)
      This method sweeps the voltage in the given range and measures the current at each voltage level by invoking private SweepVmeasureI with a CallerID of "SweepVmeasureI".
      private double[][] SweepVmeasureI(java.lang.String SMUChannel, double Start, double Stop, double Step, boolean Log, java.lang.String FileExtension, java.lang.String CallerID)
      This is a helper method that actually measures the current at different voltages as described below.

      This methods stores parameters controlling SeepVmeasureI (also in syntax-Check mode).
      double[][] testOPV(boolean PlotData)
      Simulates a real measurement for testing purposes.

      • checkErrorQueue

        private void checkErrorQueue(java.lang.String Message)
                      throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Queries the oldest entry of the 2600's Error Queue. The error is removed from the error queue. This method simply returns when no error was found in the queue or throws a ScriptException with the Error Number(s) and Message(s) if an error occurred. It also returns if in NoCommunicationMode.
        Parameters:
        Message - This String is appended to the Error Message in case an error occurred.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when GPIB communication failed (bubbles up from QueryInstrument.
        javax.script.ScriptException - if 1) the returned number of errors in the queue could not be converted into an Integer (should never happen unless GPIB transmission introduces an error), or 3) at least one error was found in the error queue.

      • configSMUChannel

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Select if the SMU Channel operates as current or voltage source</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Operation Mode {V, I}"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","V"},
                   ToolTips={"","<html>V ... Voltage source (force Voltage measure Current)<br>I ... Current source (force Current measure Voltage)</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configSMUChannel(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             java.lang.String Mode)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             javax.script.ScriptException
        Configures the SMU Channel to act as voltage or current source. It also sets the display to show the corresponding value (current or voltage).

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        Mode - The operation mode, can be V, I (case insensitive)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from Device.SendToInstrument(java.lang.String)
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the 2600's error queue contained an error
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Select the Settling Delay Time</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Delay Time [sec]","Delay Factor"},

                   ToolTips={"","<html>-1 ... Automatic delay value<br>0 ... No delay<br>>0 ... Delay Time in seconds</html>","Multiplier to the Delay Time when DelayTime is set to Automatic (-1)"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configDelayTime(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     double DelayTime,

        Configures the Settling Delay Time and the Delay factor before taking a measurement.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        DelayTime - The Settling Delay Time in Seconds, or 0 to disable the default delay times, or -1 to enable Automatic Delay Times

      • configFilters

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Configures the digital and analog Filters</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Digitial Filter Type","Filter Count","Digital Filter Enable","Analog Filter Enable"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","Repeat","3","true","true"},
                   ToolTips={"","<html>Moving ... Selects the Moving Average filter<br>Repeat ... Selects the Repeat filter<br>Median ... Selects the Median filter</html>","Number of measured readings required to yield one filtered measurement","Enables or disables digitally filtered measurements","Controls the use of an analog filter when measuring on the lowest current ranges (Models 2635A/2636A only)"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configFilters(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String FilterType,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    int FilterCount,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean DigitalFilterEnable,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean AnalogFilterEnable)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    javax.script.ScriptException
        Configures the digital and analog Filters.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        FilterType - Selects the Moving Average, Repeat Average, or the Median digital Filter
        FilterCount - The Number of measured readings required to yield one filtered measurement
        DigitalFilterEnable - Enables or disables the digital Filter
        AnalogFilterEnable - Controls the use of an analog filter when measuring on the lowest current ranges (Models 2635A/2636A only).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the 2600's error queue contained an error
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • OutputState

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Select Output State of the SMU</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Output State {on, off, highZ}"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","off"},
                   ToolTips={"","<html>When \'highZ\' is selected, the SMU will open the output relay.</html>","<html>A number greater than zero causes this method to wait until the<br>present output is below this threshold before returning<br>when the output state off is selected.</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void OutputState(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String OutputState)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        javax.script.ScriptException
        Sets the Output State of the SMU to either on, off, or high_Z. When on is selected, the SMU's mode (force V or I) is determined by configSMUChannel, when off is selected, the SMU is turned off and smuX.source.offmode determines whether 0V or 0A are sourced, and additionally, the output voltage is set to 0 using OutputV. High_Z turns off the output and opens the output relay. This method performs a Syntax-Check. This method can optionally wait until a threshold is met before returning.
        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        OutputState - The Output State of the SMU, can be on, off, or highZ (case insensitive)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from Device.SendToInstrument(java.lang.String)
        javax.script.ScriptException - if the returned answer from the Instrument could not be interpreted as a Double value (bubbles up from getDouble.
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • configVoltageSourceRange

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Switches the Auto-Ranging for the SMU Output on or off, and<br>sets the Source Range if Auto-Ranging is switched off</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Auto-Ranging?","Voltage Range"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","true","5"},
                   ToolTips={"","<html>Switching off Auto-Ranging puts the SMU into a fixed source range<br>as specified with Voltage Range.</html>","Set this value to the maximum expected voltage to be sourced"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void configVoltageSourceRange(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 boolean AutoRanging,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 double VoltageRange)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 javax.script.ScriptException
        Switches the Auto-Ranging for the SMU Output on or off, and sets the voltage source range if Auto-Ranging is switched off.
        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        AutoRanging - If true Auto-Ranging will be switched on for the specified SMU output
        VoltageRange - Sets the SMU to a fixed range large enough to source the assigned value. The instrument will select the best range for sourcing this value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from Device.SendToInstrument(java.lang.String)
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the 2600's error queue contained an error.

      • SweepVmeasureIconfig

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Configures parameters controlling the SweepVmeasureI command.<br>Must be called before SweepVmeasureI.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Hold Time [ms]","Additional Delay Time [ms]","Nr. of measurements","Nr. of averaging","Auto Stabilize"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","1000","100","15","5","false"},
                   ToolTips={"","Time between applying a new voltage and the first measurement","<html>Time between two measurements.<br>The Keithley\'s internal Delay Time is also active.</html>","Number of measurements at each voltage","Average over the last N measurements as return value","Wait until readings have stabilized or a maximum of \'Nr. of measurements\' points were measured."})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void SweepVmeasureIconfig(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               int HoldTime,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               int DelayTime,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               int NrMeasurements,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               int NrAveraging,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               boolean AutoStabilize)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        This methods stores parameters controlling SeepVmeasureI (also in syntax-Check mode). These configuration parameters are stored separately for each SMU channel.
        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        HoldTime - The time in ms between applying a new voltage and the first measurement
        DelayTime - Additional wait time between two measurements. Note that an additional delay time might be set in the Keithley 2600 (configDelayTime)
        NrMeasurements - The number of measurements that will be taken at each voltage
        NrAveraging - The return value of SweepVmeasureI is obtained by averaging over the last NrAveraging measurements.
        AutoStabilize - If true, the standard deviation and drift of the measurements is evaluated to find when the measurements are stable. To avoid deadlocks, a maximum of 'Nr. of measurements' are taken.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - When the Syntax-check fails

      • SweepVmeasureI

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Sweeps the voltage and measures the current at each voltage.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Start Voltage","Stop Voltage","Step Size","Log Sweep","File Extension"},

      • SweepVmeasureI

        private double[][] SweepVmeasureI(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                  double Start,
                                  double Stop,
                                  double Step,
                                  boolean Log,
                                  java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                  java.lang.String CallerID)
                           throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                  javax.script.ScriptException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        This is a helper method that actually measures the current at different voltages as described below. It can be called with different CallerIDs and, thus, the Chart generated looks slightly different. This is to avoid replication of code as this method is called from SweepVmeasureI as well as from MeasureOPV. Because the chart produced by these methods look different, this approach was chosen.

        This method sweeps the voltage in the given range and measures the current at each voltage level. Multiple current measurements are taken at each voltage step, and the return value is averaged over the last few measurements. An automatic stabilization detection can be selected, which evaluates the standard deviation and linear drift to determine when a measurement is stable. The parameters governing this auto-stabilization are defined in the iC.properties. Note that Auto-stabilization is un-commented at this time as it has not been tested. Note that after the applying the first voltage, an additional wait time is introduced, set by Keithley2600.SweepVmeasureI.WaitFirstVoltage in the iC.properties.

        Parameters:
        SMUChannel - The SMU Channel, can be A, B (case insensitive)
        Start - The start value of the sweep voltage
        Stop - The stop value of the sweep voltage
        Step - The step size of the sweep voltage if a linear sweep is selected, or the number of steps per decade if a log sweep is selected
        Log - Selects a linear or logarithmic scaling of the sweep voltage
        FileExtension - This extension will be added to the file name to save the measured data in a file and also the chart as a png (depending on CallerID).
        CallerID - Controlls the chart's appearance; can be 'SweepVMeasureI' or 'MeasureOPV'.
        Returns:
        A double[][] with voltage values in the first column (ret[:][0]) and the averaged current in the second (ret[:][1]) or null if the values have not been measured (e.g. when the user pressed the stop button or something else went wrong).
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the file to save the data could not be opened, or written to.
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from OutputV, or MeasureI
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - When the Syntax-check fails (can also bubble up from Device.GenerateValues

      • MeasureOPV

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Specialized command to measure and evaluate (organic) Photovoltaic Cells (OPV).<br>Sweeps the voltage and measures the current at each voltage, and<br>then extracts Voc, Isc, series- and shunt resistance, fill factor, etc.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"SMU Channel Name {A, B}","Start Voltage","Stop Voltage","Step Size","Log Sweep","File Extension"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","-0.5","0.5","0.05","false",".opv1.txt"},
                   ToolTips={"","","","Voltage Step or Number of Steps per Decade","",""})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public double[][] MeasureOPV(java.lang.String SMUChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             double Start,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             double Stop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             double Step,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             boolean Log,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             java.lang.String FileExtension)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             java.io.IOException
        Specialized method to measure (Organic) Photovoltaic Cells (OPV).

        This method sweeps the voltage in the given range and measures the current at each voltage level by invoking private SweepVmeasureI with a CallerID of "MeasureOPV. See the description of #SweepVmeasureI(String, double, double, double, boolean, String, int) for more details.

        After measuring the current, the characteristic of OPV Cell is analysed by calling EvaluateOPV and the results are written to a file. See EvaluateOPV(double[][], String) for more details on what parameters are extracted and how it's done.

        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        javax.script.ScriptException
        java.io.IOException

      • EvaluateOPV

        protected boolean EvaluateOPV(double[][] VI_Data,
                              java.lang.String FileExtension)
        Evaluates the characteristic parameters of an (organic) photovoltaic cell. The parameters extracted from the data are short circuit current Isc, open circuit voltage Voc, the voltage/current for maximum power output Vmaxpower and Imaxpower, as well as Shunt and Series resistance in a one Diode model.

        It's probably overkill, but the measured data is first interpolated using a Loess Interpolator where the fitting parameters are defined in iC.properties. To find Voc, a Pegasus solver (also from Apache Commons Math) is used. Series and shunt resistances are found from the slope of a linear interpolation around Isc and Voc; the region used is also defined in iC.properties. The so calculated Series and Shunt resistances are estimates only, and there might be better ways of extracting those values, e.g. to fit the data to the analytical formula describing the one diode equivalent circuit model (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theory_of_solar_cell). Note: In particular, the Series resistance might be more accurately extracted from the largest V, not from Voc as in this region the I(V) curve should be most linear [Olson 2009 - PhD thesis]. Also refer to [Bowden and Rohatgi] and [Nelson03 - The Physics of Solar Cells], [Pysch07], [Zhong12].

        The extracted parameters are displayed on the chart defined in the member variable m_IV_Chart. This chart is generated by SweepVmeasureI with the CallerID of "MeasureOPV". It's not the cleanest solution to pass the chart around this way, but it was the easiest. This method has protected access to be able to test it, otherwise it could be, and should be, private (see http://onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2003/11/12/reflection.html?page=2 how to access private methods.

        This method uses a LevenbergMarquardt optimizer developed by the University of Chicago, as Operator of Argonne National Laboratory. Minpack Copyright Notice (1999) University of Chicago. All rights reserved.

        Parameters:
        VI_Data - The measured data as returned from SweepVmeasureI(String, double, double, double, boolean, String, String)
        FileExtension - This extension with an appended _eval will be added to the file name to save the extracted parameters.
        Returns:
        True when the evaluation could be completed; does not mean that it is correct, just that no unexpected situation occurred.

      • Close

           throws java.io.IOException
